ground_truth: Graham comes down the stairs with his overcoat on, moves to the closet door, knocks on it before opening it, and starts down the hall. Merrill steps out of the closet for the first time. Meanwhile, Morgan pulls his eye away from the telescope set up on the window seat in his room, and Bo hugs Morgan tight, who then peels Bo's arms off of him. Graham unlocks the front door, looks down the hall shocked, and does not react but keeps staring. In another scene, Ray clutches the steering wheel tightly, turning his knuckles a yellow white, with two large bags overflowing with clothes in the truck. Graham glances at the backseat of the truck, his eyes gently move back to Ray, and drift down to the two blood-stained areas on his shirt. Tears start falling down Graham's face as Ray finally turns, his red face quivering as he talks. Ray looks at Graham, and the two men stare at each other for a beat before Ray looks away and puts the car in drive. Graham steps away as the truck moves forward and pulls down the driveway. Merrill's head is leaned against a bunch of winter coats with his eyes closed, which then open as he sits up in his chair. The chair in the closet creaks as Merrill leans forward a little towards the television screen as running is heard. Graham waits for a reply, but none comes, so he bends down where he stands and puts his head near the wood floor to try and look under the door. All he can see are the bottoms of a couple shelves in the corner of the pantry, as he's at too severe an angle. Graham sits up, only four feet away from the pantry door, looks around not knowing what to do, and his eyes fall on a bunch of kitchen knives that have spilled from a drawer onto the floor. He takes a butcher knife from the group, moves closer to the door, and uses the knife like a mirror to see under the door. Graham watches the soft reflection and then pulls the knife out. He sits there kneeling two feet from the door, takes a deep breath, and starts to lower his head under the slanted table but stops halfway down as he loses his nerve and sits up. Graham rises to his feet, places the butcher knife on the counter, starts walking across the kitchen, gets to the door, and stays like that for a long time. Then, Graham lets go of the doorknob, turns, and walks quickly across the kitchen, picks up the butcher knife, kneels down next to the pantry, ducks his head under the slanted kitchen table, places his cheek to the floor only inches from the bottom of the door, and looks into the pantry.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Graham descends down the staircase with his overcoat on, proceeds to the closet entrance, raps on it before opening it, and initiates down the corridor. Merrill emerges from the closet for the first occasion. Meanwhile, Morgan draws his eye away from the telescope set up on the window seat in his chamber, and Bo embraces Morgan firmly, who then removes Bo's arms from him. Graham unlocks the front entrance, gazes down the corridor astonished, and does not respond but continues staring. In another scene, Ray grips the steering wheel firmly, turning his knuckles a pale white, with two large sacks overflowing with garments in the truck. Graham glances at the rear of the truck, his eyes softly shift back to Ray, and drift down to the two blood-spattered areas on his shirt. Tears begin descending down Graham's face as Ray finally turns, his flushed face trembling as he speaks. Ray gazes at Graham, and the two men stare at one another for a moment before Ray looks away and puts the vehicle in motion. Graham steps away as the truck advances and pulls down the driveway. Merrill's head is leaned against a cluster of winter overcoats with his eyes closed, which then open as he sits up in his seat. The seat in the closet creaks as Merrill leans forward slightly towards the television screen as running is heard. Graham waits for a response, but none comes, so he bends down where he stands and places his head near the wooden floor to try and look beneath the door. All he can see are the bottoms of a couple shelves in the corner of the pantry, as he's at too steep an angle. Graham sits up, only four feet away from the pantry door, looks around not knowing what to do, and his eyes fall on a cluster of kitchen knives that have spilled from a drawer onto the floor. He takes a butcher blade from the collection, moves closer to the door, and uses the blade like a mirror to see under the door. Graham observes the faint reflection and then withdraws the blade. He sits there kneeling two feet from the door, takes a deep breath, and starts to lower his head under the slanted table but stops midway down as he loses his nerve and sits up. Graham rises to his feet, places the butcher blade on the counter, starts walking across the kitchen, gets to the door, and stays like that for an extended time. Then, Graham releases the doorknob, turns, and walks swiftly across the kitchen, picks up the butcher blade, kneels down next to the pantry, ducks his head under the slanted kitchen table, places his cheek to the floor only inches from the bottom of the door, and gazes into the pantry.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Graham is seen coming down the stairs with his overcoat on. The closet door is approached by him, and he knocks on it before it is opened. The hall is then started down by Graham. Merrill steps out of the closet for the first time. Meanwhile, Morgan pulls his eye away from the telescope set up on the window seat in his room, and Bo hugs Morgan tight. Bo's arms are peeled off by Morgan. The front door is unlocked by Graham, and the hall is looked down by him, shocked, without reacting but just staring. In another scene, the steering wheel is clutched tightly by Ray, turning his knuckles a yellow white, with two large bags overflowing with clothes in the truck. Graham glances at the backseat of the truck, gently moves his eyes back to Ray, then drifts down to the two blood-stained areas on his shirt. Tears start falling down Graham's face as Ray finally turns, his red face quivering as he talks. Ray looks at Graham, and the two men stare at each other for a beat before Ray looks away and puts the car in drive. As the truck moves forward and pulls down the driveway, Graham steps away. Merrill leans his head against a bunch of winter coats with his eyes closed, then opens them as he sits up in his chair. As Merrill leans forward a little towards the television screen, running is heard and the chair in the closet creaks. Graham waits for a reply, but none comes. So he bends down where he stands, puts his head near the wood floor to try and look under the door. The bottoms of a couple shelves in the corner of the pantry are all he can see, as he's at too severe an angle. Graham sits up, only four feet away from the pantry door, looks around not knowing what to do, and his eyes fall on a bunch of kitchen knives that have spilled from a drawer onto the floor. A butcher knife is taken by him from the group, and he moves closer to the door and uses the knife like a mirror to see under the door. The soft reflection is watched by Graham, and then the knife is pulled out. Kneeling two feet from the door, he takes a deep breath and starts to lower his head under the slanted table but stops halfway down as his nerve is lost, and he sits up. Graham rises to his feet, places the butcher knife on the counter, starts walking across the kitchen, gets to the door, and stays like that for a long time. Then, the doorknob is let go of by Graham, who turns and walks quickly across the kitchen, picks up the butcher knife, kneels down next to the pantry, ducks his head under the slanted kitchen table, places his cheek to the floor only inches from the bottom of the door, and looks into the pantry.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Graham descends the stairs wearing his overcoat, knocks on the closet door before opening it, and heads down the hall. Merrill emerges from the closet for the first time. Morgan pulls away from the telescope in his room, and Bo hugs him tightly before Morgan gently removes Bo's arms. Graham unlocks the front door, looks down the hall in shock, and stares. In another scene, Ray grips the steering wheel tightly, his knuckles turning white, with two large bags of clothes in the truck. Graham glances at the backseat, then at Ray, noticing two blood-stained areas on Ray's shirt. Tears fall as Ray turns, his face red and quivering. They exchange a look before Ray drives away, and Graham steps back as the truck departs. Merrill leans against winter coats with closed eyes, then sits up as the chair creaks and running is heard on the TV. Graham waits for a reply, bends down to look under the door, but only sees the bottoms of shelves in the pantry. He notices kitchen knives spilled on the floor, takes a butcher knife, and uses it as a mirror to see under the door. Kneeling two feet away, he loses his nerve, sits up, and places the knife on the counter. Graham walks across the kitchen, pauses at the door, then quickly retrieves the knife, kneels by the pantry, and peers inside.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Graham descends the stairs in his overcoat, knocks on the closet door, opens it, and walks down the hall. Merrill emerges from the closet. Morgan pulls away from his telescope, and Bo hugs him tightly before Morgan removes Bo's arms. Graham unlocks the front door, looks down the hall in shock, and stares. Ray grips the steering wheel, his knuckles turning white, with two large bags of clothes in the truck. Graham glances at the backseat, then at Ray, noticing two blood-stained areas on Ray's shirt. Tears fall as Ray turns, his face quivering, and they exchange a look before Ray drives away. Graham steps back as the truck departs. Merrill leans against winter coats, eyes closed, then opens them and leans towards the TV as running is heard. Graham waits for a reply, bends to look under the door, but only sees the bottoms of shelves. He notices kitchen knives on the floor, takes a butcher knife, and uses it as a mirror to see under the door. Kneeling two feet away, he loses his nerve, stands, places the knife on the counter, and walks across the kitchen. He returns, picks up the knife, kneels by the pantry, and looks inside.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Graham, wearing his overcoat, descends the stairs with a purposeful stride. He approaches the closet door, gives it a polite knock before opening it, and then proceeds to make his way down the hallway. At this moment, Merrill emerges from the closet for the very first time. Meanwhile, in another part of the house, Morgan pulls his eye away from the telescope that is set up on the window seat in his room. Bo, filled with affection, hugs Morgan tightly, but Morgan gently peels Bo's arms off of him. Graham, now at the front door, unlocks it and looks down the hallway with a shocked expression on his face. He does not react immediately but continues to stare intently. In a different scene, Ray is seen clutching the steering wheel with such force that his knuckles turn a pale yellow-white. In the truck, there are two large bags overflowing with clothes. Graham glances at the backseat of the truck, his eyes gently shifting back to Ray, and then they drift down to notice two blood-stained areas on Ray's shirt. Tears begin to fall down Graham's face as Ray finally turns to him, his face red and quivering as he speaks. Ray looks directly at Graham, and the two men lock eyes for a brief moment before Ray looks away and puts the car in drive. Graham steps back as the truck begins to move forward and pulls down the driveway. Meanwhile, Merrill is resting his head against a pile of winter coats, his eyes closed, but they open as he sits up in his chair. The chair in the closet creaks slightly as Merrill leans forward a little towards the television screen, where the sound of running can be heard. Graham waits expectantly for a reply, but when none comes, he bends down where he stands and places his head near the wooden floor, attempting to look under the door. All he can see are the bottoms of a couple of shelves in the corner of the pantry, as his angle is too severe. Graham sits up, only four feet away from the pantry door, looking around uncertainly, not knowing what to do next. His eyes fall on a bunch of kitchen knives that have spilled from a drawer onto the floor. He picks up a butcher knife from the group, moves closer to the door, and uses the knife like a mirror to see under the door. Graham watches the soft reflection for a moment and then pulls the knife back. He remains kneeling two feet from the door, takes a deep breath, and starts to lower his head under the slanted table but stops halfway down as he loses his nerve and sits up again. Graham rises to his feet, places the butcher knife on the counter, and starts walking across the kitchen. He reaches the door and stays there for a long time, contemplating. Then, Graham lets go of the doorknob, turns around, and walks quickly across the kitchen. He picks up the butcher knife once more, kneels down next to the pantry, ducks his head under the slanted kitchen table, places his cheek to the floor only inches from the bottom of the door, and looks intently into the pantry.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Graham, dressed in his reliable overcoat, descends the staircase with a deliberate and purposeful stride, as if he is on a mission. As he approaches the closet door, he pauses momentarily to give it a polite and respectful knock before gently opening it. With this small task completed, he continues on his journey down the hallway. In a significant and unexpected moment, Merrill, for the very first time, emerges from the confines of the closet. Meanwhile, elsewhere within the same house, Morgan, who has been absorbed in his astronomical observations, pulls his eye reluctantly away from the telescope that is meticulously set up on the window seat in his cozy room. Bo, overwhelmed with affection and warmth, embraces Morgan tightly in a heartfelt hug, but Morgan gently and kindly peels Bo's arms away from his body. At this point, Graham reaches the front door; he unlocks it and, with a sudden and shocked expression across his face, looks down the hallway. He does not react immediately, choosing instead to continue staring intently at the scene before him. In a separate and concurrent scene, Ray is depicted clutching the steering wheel of his vehicle with such intensity and force that his knuckles have turned a pale, ghostly yellow-white. Inside the confines of the truck, there are two large bags that are overflowing with clothes, creating a chaotic and cluttered environment. Graham's eyes briefly shift to the backseat of the truck, but his gaze gently returns to Ray, then drifts downward to notice two conspicuous blood-stained areas on Ray's shirt. This sight brings tears to Graham's eyes, and the tears begin to fall as Ray finally turns toward Graham. Ray's face is red and quivering as he speaks, looking directly at Graham, and their eyes lock momentarily in a silent exchange before Ray breaks eye contact, averting his gaze and putting the car in drive. Graham steps back just as the truck starts to move forward, pulling down the driveway. During this time, Merrill is resting his weary head against a pile of winter coats, his eyes closed in contemplation, but they open as he sits upright in his chair. The chair, nestled within the closet, emits a slight creak as Merrill leans forward a little toward the television screen, where the persistent sound of running footsteps can be heard. Graham, waiting expectantly for a response that does not come, bends down to where he stands and lowers his head toward the wooden floor, attempting to get a better view underneath the door. However, all he can see are the bottoms of a couple of shelves located in the corner of the pantry, as his viewing angle is too steep and limited. Graham sits up, still only four feet away from the pantry door, looking around with uncertainty, unsure of what action to take next. His eyes land on a collection of kitchen knives that have tumbled from a drawer onto the floor. He selects a butcher knife from the scattered group, moves cautiously closer to the door, and uses the reflective surface of the knife as a makeshift mirror to see under the door. Graham watches the soft reflection intently for a moment, then pulls the knife back. Remaining kneeling just two feet from the door, he takes a deep breath and begins to lower his head under the slanted table once more, but stops halfway, losing his nerve and sitting upright again. Gathering his resolve, Graham rises to his feet, places the butcher knife back on the counter, and starts walking across the kitchen. He reaches the pantry door, staying there a long time, lost in contemplation. Eventually, Graham releases the doorknob, turns around, and walks quickly back across the kitchen. Determined, he picks up the butcher knife again, kneels down beside the pantry, ducks his head under the slanted kitchen table, places his cheek to the floor mere inches from the bottom of the door, and looks intently into the shadowy depths of the pantry.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Graham descends the stairs, each step deliberate, with his overcoat draped over his shoulders, and makes his way to the closet door. He pauses momentarily, raises his hand to knock gently on the door, and then opens it, revealing the hallway beyond. As he begins to walk down the hall, Merrill emerges from the closet for the first time, stepping out cautiously. Meanwhile, in another room, Morgan is intently peering through a telescope positioned on the window seat, his eye pressed against the lens. Bo approaches Morgan, wrapping her arms tightly around him in a hug, which prompts Morgan to gently peel Bo's arms away from him. Graham reaches the front door, unlocks it, and as he looks down the hall, a look of shock crosses his face, yet he remains motionless, his gaze fixed in place. In a different scene, Ray grips the steering wheel with such intensity that his knuckles turn a pale yellow-white, while two large bags, brimming with clothes, sit in the truck. Graham, seated in the truck, glances at the backseat before his eyes shift back to Ray, then drift down to notice two blood-stained areas on Ray's shirt. Tears begin to well up and fall down Graham's face as Ray finally turns towards him, his face flushed and trembling as he speaks. Ray meets Graham's eyes, and for a moment, the two men lock eyes in silence before Ray looks away, shifts the car into drive, and begins to pull away. Graham steps back, watching as the truck moves forward and down the driveway. Back inside, Merrill rests his head against a pile of winter coats, his eyes closed in thought, before they flutter open and he sits up in his chair. The chair creaks softly as Merrill leans forward slightly, his attention drawn to the television screen, while the sound of running fills the room. Graham, waiting for a response that never comes, bends down where he stands, lowering his head close to the wooden floor in an attempt to peer under the door. His view is limited to the bottoms of a couple of shelves in the pantry's corner, as the angle is too steep. Sitting up, just four feet from the pantry door, Graham looks around, uncertain of his next move, until his eyes land on a collection of kitchen knives that have spilled from a drawer onto the floor. He selects a butcher knife from the assortment, approaches the door, and uses the knife's reflective surface to peer under the door. Observing the soft reflection, he then withdraws the knife, kneeling two feet from the door, taking a deep breath. He begins to lower his head under the slanted table but hesitates, losing his nerve, and sits up again. Rising to his feet, Graham places the butcher knife on the counter, strides across the kitchen, and reaches the door, where he pauses for a long moment. Eventually, he releases the doorknob, turns swiftly, and walks back across the kitchen, retrieves the butcher knife, kneels beside the pantry, ducks his head under the slanted kitchen table, and presses his cheek to the floor, mere inches from the door's bottom, to peer into the pantry.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Graham descends the stairs wearing his overcoat, knocks on the closet door before opening it, and proceeds down the hall as Merrill emerges from the closet. Meanwhile, Morgan steps away from his telescope, and Bo hugs him tightly before Morgan gently releases Bo's arms. Graham unlocks the front door, looks down the hall in shock, and continues to stare. In another scene, Ray grips the steering wheel tightly, with two large bags of clothes in the truck. Graham glances at the backseat, notices the blood-stained areas on Ray's shirt, and tears fall as Ray turns to him, his face quivering. They share a moment of eye contact before Ray looks away and drives off, with Graham stepping back as the truck departs. Merrill, resting against winter coats, opens his eyes and leans forward towards the television as running is heard. Graham, waiting for a reply, bends down to peer under the pantry door but can only see the bottoms of shelves. Unsure of what to do, he notices kitchen knives spilled on the floor, takes a butcher knife, and uses it as a mirror to look under the door. After watching the reflection, he sits back, takes a deep breath, and hesitates before rising to place the knife on the counter. He then walks across the kitchen, pauses at the door, and eventually returns to pick up the knife, kneels by the pantry, and peers inside with his cheek to the floor.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Graham comes down the stairs with his overcoat on, a thick wool garment that used to belong to his grandfather, moves to the closet door, knocks on it before opening it, and starts down the hall. Merrill, who had been hiding there since the storm began, steps out of the closet for the first time. Meanwhile, Morgan pulls his eye away from the telescope set up on the window seat in his room, a prized possession he received on his tenth birthday, and Bo hugs Morgan tight, who then peels Bo's arms off of him, comforting her as she shivers slightly from the cold. Graham unlocks the front door, looks down the hall shocked by the eerie silence, and does not react but keeps staring. In another scene, Ray clutches the steering wheel tightly, turning his knuckles a yellow white, driving through the deserted streets with two large bags overflowing with clothes in the truck. Graham glances at the backseat of the truck, which is littered with children's toys and old water bottles, his eyes gently move back to Ray, and drift down to the two blood-stained areas on his shirt, remnants of the incident neither wants to speak of yet. Tears start falling down Graham's face as Ray finally turns, his red face quivering as he talks, revealing the grief he has been holding back. Ray looks at Graham, and the two men stare at each other for a beat before Ray looks away and puts the car in drive, the old engine rumbling to life. Graham steps away as the truck moves forward and pulls down the driveway, leaving a cloud of dust behind. Merrill's head is leaned against a bunch of winter coats with his eyes closed, which then open as he sits up in his chair. The chair in the closet creaks, a relic from Graham's college days, as Merrill leans forward a little towards the television screen as running is heard, indicating the children are still playing outside. Graham waits for a reply, but none comes, so he bends down where he stands and puts his head near the wood floor to try and look under the door. All he can see are the bottoms of a couple shelves in the corner of the pantry, as he's at too severe an angle. Graham sits up, only four feet away from the pantry door, looks around not knowing what to do, and his eyes fall on a bunch of kitchen knives that have spilled from a drawer onto the floor, a set he had inherited from his late aunt. He takes a butcher knife from the group, the largest of the set, moves closer to the door, and uses the knife like a mirror to see under the door. Graham watches the soft reflection, which shows nothing moving inside, and then pulls the knife out. He sits there kneeling two feet from the door, takes a deep breath, and starts to lower his head under the slanted table, an antique found at a local estate sale, but stops halfway down as he loses his nerve and sits up. Graham rises to his feet, places the butcher knife on the counter, starts walking across the kitchen, gets to the door, and stays like that for a long time, listening for any sound. Then, Graham lets go of the doorknob, turns, and walks quickly across the kitchen, picks up the butcher knife, kneels down next to the pantry, ducks his head under the slanted kitchen table, places his cheek to the floor only inches from the bottom of the door, and looks into the pantry.

Tears start falling down Graham's face as Ray finally turns his red face quivering as he talks. Ray looks at Graham and the two men stare at each other for a beat before Ray looks away and puts the car in drive. Graham steps away as the truck moves forward and pulls down the driveway. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. Merrill's head is leaned against a bunch of winter coats with his eyes closed which then open as he sits up in his chair. The chair in the closet creaks as Merrill leans forward a little towards the television screen as running is heard. Graham waits for a reply but none comes so he bends down where he stands and puts his head near the wood floor to try and look under the door. All he can see are the bottoms of a couple shelves in the corner of the pantry as he is at too severe an angle. Graham sits up only four feet away from the pantry door looks around not knowing what to do and his eyes fall on a bunch of kitchen knives that have spilled from a drawer onto the floor. He takes a butcher knife from the group moves closer to the door and uses the knife like a mirror to see under the door. Graham watches the soft reflection and then pulls the knife out. He sits there kneeling two feet from the door takes a deep breath and starts to lower his head under the slanted table but stops halfway down as he loses his nerve and sits up. Graham rises to his feet places the butcher knife on the counter starts walking across the kitchen gets to the door and stays like that for a long time. Then Graham let us go of the doorknob turns and walks quickly across the kitchen picks up the butcher knife kneels down next to the pantry ducks his head under the slanted kitchen table places his cheek to the floor only inches from the bottom of the door and looks into the pantry.

Merrill steps out of the closet for the first time. Meanwhile Morgan pulls his eye away from the telescope set up on the window seat in his room and Bo hugs Morgan tight who then peels Bo's arms off of him. Graham unlocks the front door looks down the hall shocked and does not react but keeps staring. In another scene Ray clutches the steering wheel tightly turning his knuckles. He takes a butcher knife from the group moves closer to the door and uses the knife like a mirror to see under the door. Graham watches the soft reflection and then pulls the knife out. He sits there kneeling two feet from the door takes a deep breath and starts to lower his head under the slanted table but stops halfway down as he loses his nerve and sits up. Graham rises to his feet places the butcher knife on the counter starts walking across the kitchen gets to the door and stays like that for a long time. Then Graham let us go of the doorknob turns and walks quickly across the kitchen picks up the butcher knife kneels down next to the pantry ducks his head under the slanted kitchen table places his cheek to the floor only inches from the bottom of the door and looks into the pantry.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Graham comes down the stairs with his overcoat on moves to the closet door knocks on it before opening it and starts down the hall. Merrill steps out of the closet for the first time. Graham rises to his feet places the butcher knife on the counter starts walking across the kitchen gets to the door and stays like that for a long time. Then Graham let us go of the doorknob turns and walks quickly across the kitchen picks up the butcher knife kneels down next to the pantry ducks his head under the slanted kitchen table places his cheek to the floor only inches from the bottom of the door and looks into the pantry.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Taylor comes down the stairs with his overcoat on, moves to the closet door, knocks on it before opening it, and starts down the hall. Dylan steps out of the closet for the first time. Meanwhile, Jordan pulls his eye away from the telescope set up on the window seat in his room, and Alex hugs Jordan tight, who then peels Alex's arms off of him. Taylor unlocks the front door, looks down the hall shocked, and does not react but keeps staring. In another scene, Casey clutches the steering wheel tightly, turning his knuckles a yellow white, with two large bags overflowing with clothes in the truck. Taylor glances at the backseat of the truck, his eyes gently move back to Casey, and drift down to the two blood-stained areas on his shirt. Tears start falling down Taylor's face as Casey finally turns, his red face quivering as he talks. Casey looks at Taylor, and the two men stare at each other for a beat before Casey looks away and puts the car in drive. Taylor steps away as the truck moves forward and pulls down the driveway. Dylan's head is leaned against a bunch of winter coats with his eyes closed, which then open as he sits up in his chair. The chair in the closet creaks as Dylan leans forward a little towards the television screen as running is heard. Taylor waits for a reply, but none comes, so he bends down where he stands and puts his head near the wood floor to try and look under the door. All he can see are the bottoms of a couple shelves in the corner of the pantry, as he's at too severe an angle. Taylor sits up, only four feet away from the pantry door, looks around not knowing what to do, and his eyes fall on a bunch of kitchen knives that have spilled from a drawer onto the floor. He takes a butcher knife from the group, moves closer to the door, and uses the knife like a mirror to see under the door. Taylor watches the soft reflection and then pulls the knife out. He sits there kneeling two feet from the door, takes a deep breath, and starts to lower his head under the slanted table but stops halfway down as he loses his nerve and sits up. Taylor rises to his feet, places the butcher knife on the counter, starts walking across the kitchen, gets to the door, and stays like that for a long time. Then, Taylor lets go of the doorknob, turns, and walks quickly across the kitchen, picks up the butcher knife, kneels down next to the pantry, ducks his head under the slanted kitchen table, places his cheek to the floor only inches from the bottom of the door, and looks into the pantry.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Graham comes down the ladder with his raincoat on, moves to the cupboard door, knocks on it before opening it, and starts down the corridor. Merrill steps out of the cupboard for the first time. Meanwhile, Morgan pulls his eye away from the periscope set up on the ottoman in his room, and Bo hugs Morgan tight, who then peels Bo's arms off of him. Graham unlocks the back door, looks down the corridor shocked, and does not react but keeps staring. In another scene, Ray clutches the gearshift tightly, turning his knuckles a pale green, with two large boxes overflowing with books in the trailer. Graham glances at the backseat of the trailer, his eyes gently move back to Ray, and drift down to the two mud-stained areas on his jacket. Tears start falling down Graham's face as Ray finally turns, his flushed face quivering as he talks. Ray looks at Graham, and the two men stare at each other for a beat before Ray looks away and puts the vehicle in motion. Graham steps away as the trailer moves forward and pulls down the boulevard. Merrill's head is leaned against a bunch of summer hats with his eyes closed, which then open as he sits up in his chair. The chair in the cupboard creaks as Merrill leans forward a little towards the computer screen as running is heard. Graham waits for a reply, but none comes, so he bends down where he stands and puts his head near the stone floor to try and look under the door. All he can see are the bottoms of a couple drawers in the corner of the pantry, as he's at too severe an angle. Graham sits up, only four feet away from the pantry door, looks around not knowing what to do, and his eyes fall on a bunch of garden shears that have spilled from a drawer onto the floor. He takes a carving knife from the group, moves closer to the door, and uses the knife like a mirror to see under the door. Graham watches the soft reflection and then pulls the knife out. He sits there kneeling two feet from the door, takes a deep breath, and starts to lower his head under the slanted desk but stops halfway down as he loses his nerve and sits up. Graham rises to his feet, places the carving knife on the island, starts walking across the kitchen, gets to the door, and stays like that for a long time. Then, Graham lets go of the door handle, turns, and walks quickly across the kitchen, picks up the carving knife, kneels down next to the pantry, ducks his head under the slanted kitchen desk, places his cheek to the floor only inches from the bottom of the door, and looks into the pantry.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Graham ascends the stairs with his overcoat on, heads to the closet door, taps on it before shutting it, and continues up the hall. Merrill jumps out of the closet for the first time. Meanwhile, Morgan pushes his ear away from the telescope set up on the window seat in his room, and Bo waves at Morgan, who then shakes Bo's hand off of him. Graham bolts the front door, peers down the hall confused, and does not react but keeps gazing. In another scene, Ray releases the steering wheel gently, stretching his knuckles a soft pink, with two large bags filled with clothes in the truck. Graham peers at the backseat of the truck, his eyes swiftly move back to Ray, and drop down to the two blood-stained patches on his shirt. Tears stop forming in Graham's eyes as Ray finally turns, his red face crumbling as he whispers. Ray glances at Graham, and the two men glance at each other for a beat before Ray glances away and puts the car in park. Graham jumps aside as the truck reverses and rolls up the driveway. Merrill's head rests against a bunch of winter coats with his eyes open, which then close as he stands up from his chair. The chair in the closet groans as Merrill leans backward a little away from the television screen as laughing is heard. Graham waits for a response, but none comes, so he crouches where he stands and places his head near the wood floor to try and listen under the door. All he can hear are the tops of a couple shelves in the corner of the pantry, as he's at too gentle an angle. Graham stands up, only four feet away from the pantry door, looks around uncertain what to do, and his eyes land on a bunch of kitchen knives that have scattered from a drawer onto the floor. He lifts a paring knife from the group, moves away from the door, and uses the knife like a magnifying glass to see under the door. Graham examines the clear reflection and then sets the knife down. He stands there bending two feet from the door, exhales deeply, and starts to raise his head above the slanted table but stops halfway up as he regains his courage and sits back down. Graham lowers to his knees, places the paring knife on the counter, starts running across the kitchen, reaches the door, and stays like that for a short time. Then, Graham grasps the doorknob, turns, and strolls slowly across the kitchen, grabs the paring knife, stands up next to the pantry, lifts his head above the slanted kitchen table, places his cheek to the floor only feet away from the bottom of the door, and listens into the pantry.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Milton descends the elevator with his parachute on, strides to the bookshelf handle, taps on it before swinging it open, and marches down the track. Daryl hops out of the bookshelf for the first moment. Meanwhile, Sally tugs her foot away from the microscope set up on the balcony chair in her cabin, and Tim squeezes Sally snug, who then pries Tim's hands off of her. Milton unlatches the garden gate, peers down the track startled, and does not respond but keeps gazing. In another segment, Cliff grips the joystick firmly, turning his knuckles a lilac shade, with two oversized baskets brimming with hats in the wagon. Milton peers at the back porch of the wagon, his gaze softly shifts back to Cliff, and flits down to the two ink-stained zones on his jacket. Raindrops start spilling down Milton's cheeks as Cliff finally swivels, his lavender nose trembling as he speaks. Cliff glances at Milton, and the two giraffes glare at each other for a moment before Cliff averts his eyes and shifts the wagon into motion. Milton edges away as the wagon rolls onward and pulls down the boulevard. Daryl's chin is nestled against a cluster of summer dresses with his gaze shut, which then flick open as he straightens up in his bench. The bench in the bookshelf screeches as Daryl leans forward a bit toward the computer monitor as leaping is heard. Milton pauses for a signal, but none arrives, so he stoops down where he stands and places his nose near the marble ground to attempt and gaze beneath the handle. All he can witness are the undersides of a few racks in the edge of the cabinet, as he's at too steep an angle. Milton rises up, only four inches away from the cabinet handle, surveys the space not sure of what to attempt, and his gaze lands on a collection of garden rakes that have spilled from a cupboard onto the carpet. He selects a grapefruit spoon from the cluster, moves nearer to the handle, and utilizes the spoon like a magnifier to peer beneath the handle. Milton observes the faint reflection and then retracts the spoon. He lingers there crouching two inches from the handle, takes a profound inhale, and begins to lower his chin below the tilted window but halts midway as he loses his courage and sits upright. Milton stands to his sneakers, places the grapefruit spoon on the mantel, starts strolling across the solarium, reaches the handle, and remains like that for an age. Then, Milton releases the latch, spins, and strides swiftly across the solarium, grabs the grapefruit spoon, crouches beside the cabinet, lowers his chin under the tilted window, rests his nose to the carpet only centimeters from the handle's bottom, and peers into the cabinet.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Daphne slides up the stairs with her raincoat on, glides to the wardrobe door, taps on it before opening it, and drifts down the corridor. Travis leaps out of the wardrobe for the first time. Meanwhile, Oscar pushes his nose away from the binoculars set up on the windowsill in his room, and Zoey squeezes Oscar tight, who then loosens Zoey's grip off of him. Daphne locks the back door, gazes down the corridor surprised, and does not respond but keeps peering. In another scene, Kyle hugs the dashboard tightly, turning his knuckles a ghostly pink, with two large bags overflowing with groceries in the trunk. Daphne peers at the front seat of the car, her eyes softly shift back to Kyle, and wander down to the two mud-stained spots on his jacket. Laughter begins bubbling up from Daphne's face as Kyle eventually turns, his flushed face trembling as he sings. Kyle glances at Daphne, and the two people gaze at each other for a moment before Kyle glances away and places the car in reverse. Daphne steps closer as the car rolls backward and pushes up the driveway. Travis's head is nestled against a bunch of spring jackets with his eyes open, which then close as he lies back in his chair. The chair in the wardrobe squeaks as Travis leans backward a little towards the computer screen as shuffling is heard. Daphne waits for a sound, but none arrives, so she crouches where she stands and puts her ear near the tile floor to try and listen under the door. All she can hear are the echoes of a couple boxes in the corner of the pantry, as she's at too steep an angle. Daphne stands up, only four feet away from the pantry door, glances around uncertain what to do, and her eyes land on a bunch of silver spoons that have spilled from a drawer onto the floor. She picks a ladle from the pile, reaches closer to the door, and uses the ladle like a mirror to peek under the door. Daphne observes the faint shimmer and then slides the ladle back. She sits there squatting two feet from the door, inhales deeply, and starts to raise her head above the tilted table but pauses partway up as she loses courage and kneels back. Daphne descends to her knees, places the ladle on the counter, begins pacing across the dining area, reaches the door, and stays like that briefly. Then, Daphne releases the doorknob, spins, and paces briskly across the dining area, grabs the ladle, bends down next to the pantry, ducks her head above the tilted dining table, places her ear to the floor only inches from the base of the door, and listens into the pantry.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Graham descends from the rooftops with his raincoat on, slides to the wardrobe gate, taps on it before swinging it open, and marches down the corridor. Merrill leaps out of the wardrobe for the first time. Meanwhile, Morgan shifts his gaze away from the microscope set up on the window ledge in his room, and Bo squeezes Morgan warmly, who then shakes Bo's hands off of him. Graham unlatches the garden gate, peers down the corridor bewildered, and does not respond but keeps observing. In another scene, Ray grips the bicycle handlebars loosely, turning his fingers a pale pink, with two giant bags overflowing with books in the wagon. Graham peeks at the back of the wagon, his eyes softly float back to Ray, and drift down to the two ink-stained spots on his jacket. Droplets start dripping down Graham's cheeks as Ray eventually rotates, his flushed face trembling as he whispers. Ray glances at Graham, and the two men gape at each other for a moment before Ray averts his eyes and sets the bicycle in motion. Graham steps aside as the wagon rolls forward and follows down the street. Merrill's head is rested against a pile of summer hats with his eyes shut, which then open as he rises in his hammock. The hammock in the wardrobe squeaks as Merrill leans forward a little towards the radio as singing is heard. Graham waits for a response, but none arrives, so he crouches where he stands and places his ear near the tiled floor to attempt and listen under the gate. All he can make out are the edges of a couple vases in the corner of the closet, as he's at too awkward an angle. Graham stands up, only four feet away from the closet gate, scans around unsure what to do, and his eyes land on a bunch of kitchen spoons that have tumbled from a drawer onto the floor. He picks a ladle from the pile, steps closer to the gate, and uses the ladle like a mirror to see under the gate. Graham observes the gentle reflection and then removes the ladle. He lingers there crouching two feet from the gate, inhales deeply, and begins to lower his ear under the tilted stool but halts halfway down as he loses courage and rises back. Graham gets to his toes, places the ladle on the countertop, starts strolling across the kitchen, reaches the gate, and stays like that for a considerable while. Then, Graham releases the doorknob, swivels, and strides quickly across the kitchen, retrieves the ladle, crouches next to the closet, ducks his head under the tilted kitchen stool, places his chin to the floor only inches from the bottom of the gate, and peers into the closet.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Wallace ascends up the ladder with his scarf on, shuffles to the attic window, taps on it before sliding it open, and begins up the hallway. Quentin leaps out of the attic for the first time. Simultaneously, Lance removes his foot away from the telescope stationed on the library bench in his den, and Mia hugs Lance loosely, who then shrugs Mia's grip off him. Wallace locks the balcony gate, glances up the hallway amazed, and does not respond but keeps glaring. In another scene, Neil grips the umbrella tightly, turning his knuckles a pale green, with two large crates spilling with books in the back. Wallace peeks at the rear of the van, his eyes softly shift back to Neil, and glide down to the two ink-splattered spots on his jacket. Raindrops start falling down Wallace's face as Neil finally spins, his blue face quaking as he mumbles. Neil squints at Wallace, and the two boys gape at each other for a moment before Neil looks away and sets the motorcycle in gear. Wallace leaps aside as the van rolls backward and pushes up the driveway. Quentin's head is nestled against a stack of summer hats with his eyes closed, which then open as he shifts in his hammock. The hammock in the attic creaks as Quentin leans backward a little towards the radio as dancing is heard. Wallace anticipates a response, but none arrives, so he crouches down where he stands and places his ear near the tile floor to try and hear under the wall. All he can sense are the bottoms of a couple pumpkins in the corner of the closet, as he's at too sharp an angle. Wallace stands up, only six feet away from the closet wall, surveys around uncertain of what to do, and his gaze lands on a heap of garden rakes that have tumbled from a shelf onto the ground. He takes a spade from the pile, scoots closer to the wall, and uses the spade like a periscope to peek over the wall. Wallace observes the faint reflection and then yanks the spade away. He crouches there standing three feet from the wall, inhales deeply, and starts to lift his hand over the slanted bookshelf but pauses halfway up as he loses his courage and stands back. Wallace climbs to his knees, places the spade on the table, starts tiptoeing through the living room, arrives at the wall, and stays that way for a long time. Then, Wallace releases the latch, rotates, and dashes swiftly across the living room, snatches up the spade, kneels next to the closet, curls his hand over the slanted kitchen table, rests his cheek to the tile only inches from the top of the wall, and listens into the closet.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Graham descends the stairs, knocks on the closet door, and starts down the hall as Merrill steps out. Meanwhile, Morgan pulls away from a telescope, and Bo hugs him tightly. Graham unlocks the front door, shocked by what he sees down the hall but does not react. In another scene, Ray clutches the steering wheel with blood-stained shirt visible, while Graham tears up as they exchange a glance. Merrill, sitting with his head against winter coats, leans forward to watch TV as running is heard. Graham checks under a door but can only see shelf bottoms. Noticing fallen kitchen knives, he uses a butcher knife to see under the door. Losing his nerve, Graham sits back but then quickly approaches the pantry, ducking under the table to peer inside.

like a mirror to see under the door  Graham watches the soft reflection and then pulls the knife out  He sits there kneeling two feet from the door takes a deep breath and starts to lower his head under the slanted table but stops halfway down as he loses his nerve and sits up  Graham rises to his feet places the butcher knife on the counter starts walking across the kitchen gets to the door and stays like that for a long time  Then Graham lets go of the doorknob turns and walks quickly across the kitchen picks up the butcher knife kneels down next to the pantry ducks his head under the slanted kitchen table places his cheek to the floor only inches from the bottom of the door and looks into the pantry Graham comes down the stairs with his overcoat on moves to the closet door knocks on it before opening it and starts down the hall  Merrill steps out of the closet for the first time  Meanwhile Morgan pulls his eye away from the telescope set up on the window seat in his room and Bo hugs Morgan tight who then peels Bo's arms off of him  Graham unlocks the front door looks down the hall shocked and does not react but keeps staring  In another scene Ray clutches the steering wheel tightly turning his knuckles  a yellow white with two large bags overflowing with clothes in the truck  Graham glances at the backseat of the truck his eyes gently move back to Ray and drift down to the two bloodstained areas on his shirt  Tears start falling down Graham's face as Ray finally turns his red face quivering as he talks  Ray looks at Graham and the two men stare at each other for a beat before Ray looks away and puts the car in drive  Graham steps away as the truck moves forward and pulls down the driveway
